headline.seo: N.H.L. Union’s First Proposal Offers Concessions

docs.snippet: The N.H.L. Players’ Association offered a three-year deal in which the players would take a reduced share of revenues — though less than the pay cut proposed by owners....
docs.abstract: NHL's Players' Assn makes a surprising initial proposal to league owners in negotiations toward a new collective bargaining agreement, offering significant salary concessions combined with a reformed revenue-sharing plan.
docs.lead_paragraph: The N.H.L. Players’ Association offered a three-year deal in which the players would take a reduced share of revenues — though less than the pay cut proposed by owners.

headline.print_headline: Child Is Killed and 14 People Are Hurt as L.I. House Explodes
headline.seo: Child Killed, 17 Hurt in Brentwood House Explosion
headline.main: Child Is Killed and 17 People Are Hurt as L.I. House Explodes

docs.snippet: The initial investigation indicated that the explosion, in Brentwood, “could be gas-related,” a Fire Department inspector said....
docs.abstract: House explodes in Brentwood, NY, killing a toddler and injuring 14 other people; authorities say blast may have been caused by propane gas.
docs.lead_paragraph: The initial investigation indicated that the explosion, in Brentwood, “could be gas-related,” a Fire Department inspector said.

headline.print_headline: Giants Defensive Tackle Out for Season With Blood Clot in Calf
headline.seo: N.F.L. Roundup — Giants’ Shaun Rogers Is Out for the Season
headline.main: Giants Defensive Tackle Out for Season With a Clot

docs.snippet: Defensive tackle Shaun Rogers has a blood clot in his calf that will sideline him for the entire N.F.L. season, which was to be his first with the Giants....
docs.abstract: NFL Roundup; New York Giants defensive tackle Shaun Rogers will miss the entire NFL season because of a blood clot in his calf; other developments noted.
docs.lead_paragraph: Defensive tackle Shaun Rogers has a blood clot in his calf that will sideline him for the entire N.F.L. season, which was to be his first with the Giants.

headline.seo: Grandma’s Marijuana Farm in Swaziland Is Family Payday

docs.snippet: Many of the marijuana-farming grandmothers of Swaziland, who supply South Africa’s drug market, started growing to support the offspring their children left behind when they died....
docs.abstract: Piggs Peak Journal; many of the marijuana-farming grandmothers of Swaziland, who supply South Africa’s drug market, started growing to support the offspring their children left behind when they died of AIDS; tiny nation of 1.4 million people was reported to have more acreage under marijuana cultivation in 2010 than India.
docs.lead_paragraph: Many of the marijuana-farming grandmothers of Swaziland, who supply South Africa’s drug market, started growing to support the offspring their children left behind when they died.
